com.bigdata.util.concurrent

Class ExecutionHelper<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.util.concurrent.ExecutionHelper<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The generic type of the values returned by the Callable tasks.

    public class ExecutionHelper<T>
extends Object
    Helper class for managing the execution of a set of Callable tasks on an ExecutorService.

    $Id$

        Parameters:

        timeout - The timeout for the tasks when submitted.
        unit - The unit in which that timeout is expressed.

    • Method Detail

      • submitTasks

        public void submitTasks(List<Callable<T>> tasks)
                 throws InterruptedException,
                        ExecutionExceptions
        Submit subquery tasks, wait until they are done, and verify that all tasks were executed without error. A variety of steps are taken to normalize handling interrupts, canceled execution due to timeout, and rejected execution when the ExecutorService has been shutdown.
        Parameters:
        tasks - The tasks.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - Tasks that are interrupted and tasks that are canceled due to timeout result in a logged warning and a thrown InterruptedException. Likewise, if a RejectedExecutionException is thrown and the service is shutdown, then that exception is converted into an InterruptedException.
        RejectedExecutionException - If a RejectedExecutionException is thrown and the executor service has not been shutdown.
        ExecutionExceptions - If one or more tasks fails. The causes thrown by the various tasks are available as an aid to debugging.
